page.title: 14Hanchurch Village
page.content: Mentioned in the Domesday Book Hanchurch Village still stands on the same site to the west of Stoke-on-Trent. Comprising of around forty houses it was,until the 1950's mainly inhabited by the labourers. Since then the population has altered considerably with some of the farm cottages being demolished and replaced by modern houses. The oldest building may possibly date back to the fourteenth century being of cruck construction and having seventeenth century stone and brick extentions. There is also a seventeenth century farm at the crossroads. Other buildings constructed since include a farmer coaching inn and a chapel which is a converted cow shed. On the hill overlooking the village stands a circle of yew trees at least 900 years old.
